name: Folsom Prison Blues
wikiSummary: "Folsom Prison Blues" is an American country music song credited to Johnny Cash. The song combines elements from two popular folk  genres, the train song and the prison song, both of which Cash would continue to use for the rest of his career. It has become one of Cash's signature songs and the most notable song on Cash's "At Folsom Prison" album which is widely considered to be one of the top 100 albums of all time.
wikiText: "Folsom Prison Blues" is an American country music song credited to Johnny Cash. The song combines elements from two popular folk genres, the train song and the prison song, both of which Cash would continue to use for the rest of his career. It has become one of Cash's signature songs and the most notable song on Cash's "At Folsom Prison" album which is widely considered to be one of the top 100 albums of all time. Notable covers of this song include versions done by The Gin Blossoms, Reverend Horton Heat, Brooks & Dunn and The Folsom Prison Gang.
